Japanese Fried Chiken (Karaage)
Marinade
3g garlic
10g fresh ginger
20g soy sauce
20g sake
10g mirin
3g sesame oil
0.5g ground black pepper
1 pinch cayenne pepper
1.5g white sugar
1g kosher salt
Other Ingredients
2 Chicken Legs or breasts
150g potato starch
1 spring onion
1 tbsp white sesame seeds
  1. Mince the garlic and ginger and combine all the marinade ingredients. Remove the skin from the chicken and cut into pieces then add to the marinade, massage well, and leave for at least 1 hour and potentially up to 12
  2. Mix the chicken in the marinade again, then drain any excess and toss the chicken pieces in the potato starch and rest on a grid for 15 minutes in the fridge to allow the marinade flavors to get into the starch
  3. Toast the sesame seeds until golden and finely slice the spring onions
  4. Heat the oil to 170C, and fry the chicken in batches.
  5. Raise the oil temp to 185C and fry the chicken a second time to brown well. Note the change in the bubbles as water in the coating reduces
Footer. Not much here really. Nice to have a footer though.
